intro: Leucopogon cuneifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded to partially shaded environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a leathery texture, and its flowers are usually pink or white, appearing in late spring to early summer. Leucopogon cuneifolius is often found in wetlands, pine forests, and other moist habitats across its native range.
